Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: BChampeau
Reviews.Content: My 18-year-old daughter and I recently stayed at this Ritz Carlton during her spring break vacation. After reading a few Trip Advisor reviews, I had some concerns, and called Mr. Alex Blanco, the hotel manager. He was very solicitous and genuinely seemed to want to allay my fears. He said he would locate us on a high floor to avoid street noise, and try to put us in a balcony room with a pool or bay view, as opposed to the city view, which my reservation called for. This was three weeks prior to our trip. When we arrived at the hotel, which is located about 3 blocks from the main shopping area, we found that Mr. Blanco had upgraded us to a bay view room with two queens instead of two doubles. When we got to our room, I found that Mr. Blanco had left a beautiful silver Ritz Carlton picture frame for me on the dresser with a note telling me he was at our service during our stay and hoped we would have a lovely time on my daughter's spring break. I was surprised that he remembered our previous phone conversation so exactly, and touched with the thoughtfulness of the gift. The room had a wonderful view of the bay, which was gorgeous and sunny in the morning. The room was very nice, the beds comfortable and the bathroom small, but nicely appointed. The staff were all very pleasant, helpful and eager to confirm that we were enjoying our stay. the property itself was quite lovely. All in all, I was extremely happy and satisfied with our stay, and would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Mr. Blanco, of course, gave our hotel experience that extra "Ritz Touch", and made it even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: jdocarmo
Reviews.Content: I would consider this hotel and recommend to it to anyone who is looking for a luxurious experience, a honeymoon or just a relaxing time. The hotel is beautiful, service impeccable, food incredible and the grounds are perfectly kept.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights and a very disappointing stay at the Ritz Coconut grove. A friend and I arrived for a 2 nite stay to relax and take in some Miami sights. Our room was not ready at check in time 4pm so we opted to go to the pool area and wait, the front desk clerk Katya said she would call me on my cell as soon as the room was ready. I had driven 7 hours that day and explained we were tired and hoped it would be soon. We went to the pool area and found dirty chairs everywhere and trash strewn about from leftover dirty dishes and glasses. We found a spot that was relatively clean and sat waiting for a waiter to get us a glass of wine. 20 minutes later one showed up. We ordered and wine came 10 minutes later. The wind was gusty and the plastic glass tipped o er onto my friend and a huge palm from fell on us, the waiter wandered over after the crash not to concerned, we were shaken a bit but tried to make the best of it. 90 minutes had gone by with no call from the front desk. We decided to pay our bill and check on our room. $40.00 for 2 glasses of wine, I paid the waiter and he said he could not make change and he would owe me, what?? Owe me? How crazy was that. Frustrated we went to check on our room. Oh it was ready but they had not called us. We were brought to the room and it was clean but missing robes, slippers, toiletries, wash cloths that are part of the amenities, we were assured they would be brought. The room was small with 2 beds, overlooked a roof, not great. We tipped Diego the bellman quite generously and he left. We went out for dinner and on our return we still did not have the needed items. They finally came later. Several times when leaving the hotel with packages in hand staff was near the heavy entrance doors just standing there with no offer of help to hold the doors for us 2 ladies! Even after the big tip. I was asked by the desk at check in what newspaper I wanted each morning, I replied the Miami paper, it was never delivered either day. At check out we decided to have breakfast before our long car ride. We waited 15 minutes for the waitress, and after another 10 minutes to get coffee, another 10 minutes for cream, another 10 minutes and 3 requests for juice. The staff looked so confused, what is going on at this hotel? I mentioned our issues to the desk and they kindly comped breakfast. Anthony was the the only staff member to give true Ritz service the rest need to be fired! At check out we called for a bellman and waited 30 minutes called again and they said they had forgotten to send someone. In a nutshell I booked the Ritz expecting a 5 star experience, and it did not measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: framerman777
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at this Hotel, Many events happen in coconut grove and we were glad to be there during the art festival. The staff was excellent and the food at the Hotel was very good . This Hotel is within walking distance to many nice shops and we felt very safe walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Close location to Coconut Grove Art Festival”
Reviews.Author: travelop
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location to enjoy the art festival and close to many fabulous Coconut Grove Restaurants. The beautiful warm weather with water front breezes and proximity to everything is wonderful. We didn't need our car the entire long weekend. THe Ritz is beautiful and the staff very nice. It almost meets the typical Ritz standards but there are other Ritz hotels that have perfected the "Ritz experience" The rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable. It was a busy weekend and when we arrived they were out of King beds so we had two doubles and wish they had been Queens. He offered to look for a king the next night and we were told he would get back to us but never did. The house keeping staff does a wonderful job keeping the bathrooms stocked with fresh fluffy towels and a nice turn down service in the evenings. Our bell man and concierge secured complimentary tickets to the art festival which was a wonderful added bonus! The pool is peaceful and the drinks are fantastic. Do ask for the chair covers as the thick chair pads are in need of a good washing:) It is a truly beautiful older hotel and the stay was great but for the reward points, I think there are other Ritz Carlton's (Naples, Palm Beach and Key Biscayne) that seem to really reach out to make sure you have an amazing Ritz Carlton experience. This was our second trip to this hotel and we will come back- I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Retreat”
Reviews.Author: BosoxKen
Reviews.Content: Had a 45 day conference here and it was amazing. The staff was incredibly helpful and attentive without being overly solicitous. The rooms were nice (though could have used more drawer space for clothes as was with my spouse). The food and amenities were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference at Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toddennyc
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for a work conference. I arrived with other coworkers at 10am and surprisingly our rooms were ready. The resort is beautiful, but it is that traditional luxury look that is becoming dated in general. The conference services team executed a perfect conference. My room was appointed nicely. The beds were very comfortable and maybe the best I slept in all year. Forget Starwood's Heavenly Bed. The bed at this Ritz is 100x times better. My interactions with all staff was met with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravelerfla
Reviews.Content: I get to the Miami area periodically for business and have stayed here 3 times. This is a great choice. The only drag is the construction on the road in front of the hotel makes it nearly impossible to get in the place. Once inside, no worries. I would highly recommend this Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Stay here !”
Reviews.Author: JetsetterinAsia
Reviews.Content: I arrived today and met wonderful front desk staff on my arrival. Two really nice guys who gave me an upgrade to a suite, which I am so grateful for. I flew 23 hours from Singapore for a 2 day work conference. I sent pictures to my wife...back at home with 3 kids in Singapore...oopppss Just a nice feeling hotel. We had a work function in the outside terrace area tonight which everyone felt bad about because they put on this wonderful food and almost everyone had already eaten beforehand. The female host was very inviting. Sorry folks. It was excellent though. My mother would have scolded all of us !! Stay here...Seriously. It is Ritz Carlton standard. The staff here at Ritz Carton Coconut Grove should be proud. Nice work guys,,,see you again soon - and our next conference WILL BE HERE ! I promise.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andreas68_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in January, and loved the hotel - from the friendly and efficient service at check-in, the always present and helpful valets, the spacious, clean and pleasant room and the delicious breakfast. It is located in the quiet and pleasant Coconut grove, just minutes from Brickell.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY BAD for a Ritz, management atrocious !”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at RC coconut grove right before new years. There were 3 adults in our room. We confirmed upon check in that our room would have 2 beds and were assured it would. Then were told our room was not ready and they would call us, advised us to go to the pool. Which we did. We had just got in and were hungry so we tried to get food by the pool. It took over 30 minutes before someone took my order but they were glad to complain to me about the manager. We asked for help finding chaises to sit in as there were NONE. No one ever got us chairs, we ended up having to sit on the ground for 4 hours. We asked for towels and got more complaints about the manager from staff but waited at least an hour before we even got towels. Hours went by and we never got a call about our room so we went to check on it. Turns out our room had been ready for hours and no one bothered to let us know. We get to our room, guess what? ONE BED. We call the desk. "Sorry that's our last room, we'll send you a cot". You've got to be kidding me! Left with no other choice as it was new years eve we had to stay. Thanks for ruining our holiday trip Ritz Carlton, Coconut Grove. They send up a 5ft cot for a 6ft man to sleep in. TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE! I didn't pay this much money to sleep in a tiny cot! My friend goes to the lobby to grab a snack before we leave for south beach because we have no desire to spend time in this hotel. The lobby reeks of some sort of rose perfume which made some of us allergic. I meet my friend in the lobby and sit. The waiter doesn't acknowledge my arrival, offers me no water, no menu...just ignores me the whole time as i am forced to watch my friend eat and am offered nothing. We go to get our car from valet and am shocked again that they want to charge us $15 every time we park the car. Valet was forced as they won't let you park your own car and there is so much construction around the hotel you can't park on the street anywhere nearby. We say "are you serious? we are guests?!" The valet replies "oh you are staying here? Then it is $40". What?! So visitors to the hotel pay $15 but guests pay $40? What a joke. The manager of this hotel runs it like it is a Days Inn. The manager was useless in terms of dealing with any and all problems we had during our stay. I have stayed at other RC hotels and the like and never had problems like these. This is a 2 star hotel with a 5 star name. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Naima1922
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents true 5-Star quality. The linens were of the finest quality, and our suite was BEAUTIFUL! The service was of supreme quality, and the food was outstanding! We have vowed to return for every 5th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Love Ritz Carlton but NOT this one!”
Reviews.Author: luvhrsz
Reviews.Content: When we travel we usually stay in very nice hotels, and very often in a Ritz Carlton. I've never been disappointed in an RC property before, but the RC at Coconut Grove managed to disappoint in a big way. We were in Miami for 2 nights with our 2 sons (older teenagers). We were in a very nice suite...however there was only one sink, which I found unusual. There was a lot of construction going on with another part of the building, so from some unearthly hour in the morning until late afternoon there was absolutely no peace whatsoever due to the constant outdoor construction with cranes, bull dozers, etc. Usually in an RC there are a few shops,....or at least one, where you might find toiletries, etc. This RC does not have a single shop. The breakfast was quite unappetizing. Pastries were clearly not fresh. The scrambled egg container had about 2 servings left and those looked like they had been in there for some time, so I sat down and just waited to see if they would bring out fresh eggs. After 20 minutes, the chef came out, checked all the containers, including the eggs, and went back into the kitchen. 20 minutes later....still no fresh eggs. (I was eating other things from the buffet while I waited.) I finally asked the manager to bring some fresh eggs, and it was only then that fresh eggs were put out. She did bring me my own plate, which was nice but should not have had to happen. The breakfast service was not good....our waitresses were not attentive. In addition, the fire alarms went off 4 times in 2 days. One of those times was later at night after we were all ready for bed. It turns out that this is a regular occurrence for this Ritz because the residences and the hotel are on the same system. Apparently any tiny thing can set it off. The trouble is, most of the staff just ignore the alarms. It's like the boy that cries wolf...what happens when it's a real emergency? No....as much I love Ritz Carlton, I do NOT recommend the Coconut Grove RC.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Normal Ritz but Manangement of Hotel way off”
Reviews.Author: NYEVAN
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent biz traveler and stay at Ritz, Four Seasons, etc., for the level of service afforded to its clients. While this hotel is very nice, up to Ritz standards, the management of the hotel and level of service is awful. No one picks up phones, my bill was not ready when checking out, etc. In fact, as I write this review I have been waiting on hold with the hotel for 20min trying to get my bill they did not have ready when I checked out yesterday. No one was picking up their main line, etc. Really embarresing for a Ritz. Run like a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it would be better.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle G
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults 2 kids) stayed here for 4 days this past week. I have stayed at several Ritz Carltons before and was surprised at the issues that we had this time. The minute you walk in you are overwhelmed by the scent of roses. It was nice but overbearing. Breakfast the next a.m. was so bad. Not just the service, but the breakfast buffet was awful. The choices were awful. Just simply lame. The next a.m. We decided to order off of the menu. That was what we had planned to do if we had anyone waiting on us. After about 20 minutes of asking several people to take our order I did get a cup of ice cold coffee. It was at this time I decided to leave and go eat somewhere else. The same day it was after 4:00 when we had to call and have someone make up our room. The same night we went down to the pool, I even called to ask if they had towels down there and was told yes. Well, needless to say there were no towels and I had to carry 2 freezing children up to the room. The next day went to the pools again, this time in the middle of the afternoon, still no towels even asked for someone to bring us one 2 times- never got the towel. Had to go into the spa and find one on our own. Might sound like small trivial things, but when you are spending this kind of $$ you expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Only recommended for business travellers!”
Reviews.Author: RM3011
Reviews.Content: I booked this in a hurry - thinking this is a well known 5 star brand and should meet International Ritz standards. I think our first disappointment was that the hotel is far away from South Beach ( and I completely acknowledge that the hotel is not to blame for this) - so my biggest recommendation is that if you are travelling to Miami for some fun, party and good music - I would recommend booking other hotels on Miami South Beach. Return fare from this hotel to South Beach work out to be $70 ($30-35 each way) - so I think we would have been better off spending these $70 on a room closer to the main area. The other disappointment was that our check-in person did not inform us about the buffet breakfast - so we ended up ordering ala-carte in the room. There were no room service menus available - and we had to call up reception twice to ask for their menu- slightly disappointed here. There were road works going on in the area, so it's really tricky if you want to walk around the property a little - not something you expect if you are staying in a 5 star and paying 5 star rates- right? The beach closer to the hotel was really quite - so we assume all the fun happens in the South Beach area only. To summarise, I would recommend this hotel to business travellers who have work close to 27th avenue only. For the party lovers - go to South Beach !! Also please don't pay for "Bay view " rooms - they are not worth additional money as there is hardly any view!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: philk1957
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 3 nights at the Ritz Carlton in Coconut Grove - the service was great except breakfast seemed to have trouble getting it to work. We had a suite - very spacious but dated; bed was a bit hard having just spent a week at Trump Soho most comfortable bed ever. The road construction was significant although didn't bother us as we wern't there during the day. You would want to get a room at the back. Location is a short 10 minute walk to shops and resturants but worked for us as visiting daughter at Uni of Miami. Overall positive but hotel needs a makeover in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet in a very sophisticated ambiance”
Reviews.Author: BrazilAca
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton hotel in Coconut Groove is fantastic for those seeking some peace and quiet in Miami! Very different form the hotels in Miami Beach! This is a traditional and sophisticated hotel. The rooms are very spacious, great bathrooms and balcony with great view. The pool is very nice. The staff is helpful and cordial. All that a great hotel should have. The only downside is the restaurant! They simply donâ€™t have a good restaurant for guests that do not wish to leave the hotel. Wellâ€¦the location is perfect and youâ€™re just a few minutes walking from the main street of Coconut Groove where youâ€™ll find great restaurants with a great atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “A bit uneven for a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: drjlinder
Reviews.Content: A mixture of pluses and minuses. Heavy road construction in front of the hotel. After great effort we were able to be relocated to the opposite side, which was great. Check this before coming. The breakfast service in the restaurant was a struggle. No water forever. My tomato juice was delayed because "they are making it" however, room service and poolside food was excellent. Some staff are top drawer. Others need training. . No answer half the time when calling valet desk. Keys lose their programming if you look at them cross eyed. Nothing too horrible, just not like most Ritz experiences. Close to Coconut Grove, nice shops and restaurants. I'd come back, but with different expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: briang401
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ritz Carlton in May 2010, and although it is natuarally expensive due to the lovely area it is located, nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. For a holiday, the rooms were more than big enough in size and content, and the beds were very comfortable, but it is the staff that make the difference at any level of establishment, and we left feeling we were very well looked after by employees hapy in their job. We were certainly very pleased we stayed in Coconut Grove, and not South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Charles A
Reviews.Content: Close to shopping and area restaurants. Room service is quick and reasonably priced. Concierge was very helpfully and made our stay very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location, but not that impressive for a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: DANIELAORTIZM
Reviews.Content: I was staying here couple of weeks ago, the lobby and the service itÂ´s amazing but the rooms are not that impressive as you can expect for a Ritz - Carlton.What you are paying is the excellent location close to the Art Deco district and the shopping area

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Interior, Lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: SKBritt
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night but it was lovely, the staff were so friendly and welcoming after a long flight...and an even longer wait in Miami Airport for Passports, luggage cars etc. We also ate in the restaurant and it was a real shame as we were 1 of only 3 tables that night so very quiet. The food though as great, tasty and reasonable prices considering we're in a Ritz Carlton so that was a pleasant surprise. My husband had arranged for a rose petal welcome in the bedroom, very romantic :) My only slight disappointment was the pool area, we were out reletively early I guess but all of the mattresses had been left out on the beds and it had rained overnight so although we were given towels we were sitting on very damp beds, the pool could have done with a clean and the area generally looked a little 'un loved'. this was the only area that didn't live up to expectations though so don't be put off, maybe we just caught them on an off day

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous getaway”
Reviews.Author: BarbBoston
Reviews.Content: We just spent two glorious nights at the Coconut Grove Ritz. The property is beautiful. Our room was fantastic and service was equally good. The hotel is on the Bay, so request a room with a view. It was great to be able to walk around Coconut Grove. I was totally impressed The food and service at the restaurant was excellent. The pool is very cold and I am a swimmer. I spoke with the Manager of the Hotel, Jacqueline Volkart, prior to our visit and she really went over and beyond to make sure our stay was special. Thank you! to everyone at Coconut Grove! Only issue..if you need a taxi, call in advance.

Reviews.Title: “the Grove is a Groove”
Reviews.Author: habanadaydreamin
Reviews.Content: We were invited to a party in Cocoanut Grove and we wanted to stay close so we chose the Ritz and were happy we did. From the first minute there till we left we felt pampered. The room was very comfortable with sliding glass doors that opened up to a nice breeze and a water view. The brunch was amazing. Best part it was close to everything and we were able to walk to the party!

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: wosster
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and found the location of this hotel was very good. We stayed in the executive suite both times. The room was a very good size and having 2 toilets was an added bonus. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time”
Reviews.Author: mizgbad
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the front desk greeted us by name and made us feel very welcome from the start. Since we told them it was our first time visiting the area they were very helpful in letting us know where to go out for nightlife and a bite to eat. The first night stay was kind of off to a rough start because we stayed out until about 3 am and we were woken up around 7 am with construction going on, I called downstairs to the front desk and asked them could we change rooms and without hesitation they switched our room in about 45 mins, very impressive. The whole trip was for my better half to do a few photo shoots he had scheduled and they were kind enough to let him use their beautiful hotel as a back drop. We will definately be back! ~Only thing I wish is they had an airport shuttle~

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: jgallag
Reviews.Content: You drive up to valet service (only option), open your door and smell roses. The service here is amazing!! The rooms are nice. We got a great rate. This place is about service. Construction was going on outside. It did not bother us, but it was not lush landscaping. It is more in the business district. Inside the hotel is gorgeous and stately. You need a car to stay here. No beach access. South Beach is ~ 30 minutes away. Make sure you go!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: Zeena30196
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay if you're in for a quiet Miami experience a bit outside the Miami beach extravaganza. The service was perfect and the hotel is very well kept! Highly recommended! Pros: (a) Wonderful service: the concierge, receptionist, parking attendants, and waiters were exceptionally helpful and nice. they went out of their way to make our stay better. (b) room service was impeccable (c) the view from the balcony (we got the bay view) was nice and it was a perfect place to sit and have breakfast (yes pamper yourself to a balcony breakfast) (d) although the area (coconut grove) is a bit too mainstream (Gap, Starbucks etc) there are two *wonderful* upscale restaurants: The Jaguar (Peruvian) and Le Bouchon (french bistro) that added to the experience! Cons: (a) far from South Beach (30$ cab ride one way); (b) the walls separating the rooms are too thin (there's a door between the rooms) and we could hear everything our neighbors were doing and saying (use your imagination). BUT we asked the to be relocated to another room with no neighbors and things were fine

Reviews.Title: “Service is great - good choice for business function”
Reviews.Author: KosmoK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Coconut Grove for a week long business meeting. The hotel's staff truly go above and beyond - they are exceptional. The service for our meeting was top notch, the food was great, I would recommend it to anyone. The only reason I have rated a 4 instead of a 5 is the location. The shopping and restaurant options are okay around the hotel, but I personally would have preferred to be closer to South Beach/more action.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great service, confusion over billing”
Reviews.Author: nibster
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton really was lovely and they were incredibly helpful. We had great service. My partner was doing a lot of phone interviews and it was no problem when we checked-in to arrange a late check-out on our final day. The hotel was very well presented, with an excellent and well appointed gym, and a very nice outdoor pool and sun area. It was nice as well to have a balcony with our room too. The bar and restaurant were both excellent and we were looked after well. We made use of the room service too, which was delicious. There were lots of special touches with the service, such as the man on the concierge who offered to take our Fed Ex package and drop it off on his way home to avoid us a collection charge from the hotel. The only slight frustration was the confusion over our billing and the fact that we were told we would be emailed a statement of our bill which we didn't receive. Otherwise everything was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option for a Business Stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: MFabulous
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Ritz in Coconut Grove and a pleasant stay it was. The hotel is a classic Ritz with all the professionalism, service and high standards that you find at almost all Ritz Hotels. The location is great as it is away from the rift-raft of South Beach and not in the boring downtown area. Its also walking distance to great restaurants by Coco Walk and the marina if you just need to take a walk and unwind. Its also convenient to downtown Miami and a very short drive from the airport. There is a 24 hour fitness center and very nice pool too. My deluxe room was super clean. I basically got everything that I'd expect from a Ritz. This is a great option if you're travelling on business and need an upscale and convenient place to stay in Miami. I wouldn't stay here on vacation as its not near the beach. Since it is the end of June, I got a crazy low rate of $225 per night which included breakfast, valet parking and internet access. Where can you get that value at a Ritz?

Reviews.Title: “I had a horrible experience with the lack of security inside of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrearotman
Reviews.Content: I was attending the Eye4travel Conference at the Hotel while my jewelry was stolen from my room.The hotel security and management denied this illegal act instead of protecting the guestÂ´s right and belongings. I had to call the police and file the claim. The Ritz-Carlton has not cooperated with the investigation nor responding for the acts of its employees. I would not recommend to stay there, they are very dishonest

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel with classic service”
Reviews.Author: AreMorch2011
Reviews.Content: Great to experience the service from the Ladies and Gentlemen from Ritz Carlton. As a business traveler all services was provided as expected. Will recommend this Hotels to my friends and network.

Reviews.Title: “Great business experience and service (and the BED = amazing!)”
Reviews.Author: AJBoston5996
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this Ritz last year to attend a conference that was being held on-site. After hours of flight delays and travel hassles, I arrived at the hotel right around 11pm to someone waiting for my cab. To my horror, they were not there to welcome me, but to tell me they were overbooked and to send me to the Residence Inn across the street. They wouldn't even let me step into the luxurious lobby that looked so inviting... Needless to say, I was not pleased so when I booked the hotel this year for the same conference, I made a point of contacting them to let them know I would be checking in late and to please (PLEASE) hold a room for me this time around. Not only did they hold a room, but they upgraded me and I was given free room service! They more than made up for their goof last year. Their customer service truly is excellent. The hotel is what you would expect a Ritz to be - beautiful and luxurious (and expensive). The guestroom was large and the bed was just AMAZING, I could have stayed in it all day (especially with the 2 extra large down pillows I was able to request when I booked online). Since this was a business trip, I didn't experience the spa or pool, but the grounds were well kept and lovely. I would definitely stay again and I hope next year's conference stays on this property!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, shame about the rest.”
Reviews.Author: AnonymusLondon
Reviews.Content: I agree with many previous reviewers: this hotel is definitely not a typical Ritz Carlton. First of all the good bits: the staff. Every single employee is delightful, friendly and eager to help. A very rare find these days. Which is why I can't understand how the hotel gets everything else so wrong, despite managing the hardest part: good staff and service. The rooms are average and if you are unlucky to get one on the lower floors, way below average considering the room rate. They're just full of paradoxes. There's a lint remover in the room, but the bathtub doesn't have a shower extension (so what's the point..) and the safe is so small you can hardly fit a wallet and keys in it. The bathrooms are rather nice, but the toiletries are basic at best. The TV is massive and high end, but there isn't even a chest of drawers in the room. The pool area is really quite spartan, with a very small pool considering the size of the hotel. The breakfast buffet must be the worse I have seen in a luxury hotel. There is hardly anything there, not even sliced bread. Admittedly, you can order it from the waiter, but not of great use if you are in a rush. Continental breakfast is a plate, with 4 pieces of pastries on it, that's it. In all other hotels of this calibre, there's general a continental buffet option, which includes all cold items, like fruit or yoghurt. Not there: you either pay for the full buffet ($30 inc tax), or you have to order a-la-carte, which works out at pretty much the same price, for a coffee, some fruit and a pastry. I was really disappointed and seeing that there have been quite a few similar negative reviews prior to mine, I find it even more disappointed that there has been no management response to these reviews, which makes me wonder if management even cares. They must care about their stuff, otherwise they wouldn't be so nice, which I guess it's a great start, but guests are important too.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing (compares)”
Reviews.Author: jms-ny-usa
Reviews.Content: First to CCGrove altho many to MIA, SOBA, Keys + many to Ritz Carltons, FSH, etc. This is a truly spectacular venue: design, service, food quality, friendliness of staff, setting -- did I say 'service?' A truly winning formula -- and it seems to come easy to them. It's like a blend of Asian opulence and European (Brasilian) charm. Best hotel experience in a decade or more. Go - you'll love it

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Feel Like a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: familyfour65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, but it just doesn't have the feel of a Ritz. We stayed one night after we arrived in Miami, before we went to the keys. We had reservations to come back when we returned to Miami, but cancelled that reservation and opted to go to the Four Seasons, which we are glad we did. In the morning, there was no coffee to take with you and parking was $32 a night. I expect for what we pay to stay here, they could have coffee to take as you leave. I had to go to the bar and pay $5 a cup. The people were nice. We were given a letter at check in that construction would be taking place 8-5. At about 7, ww heard a very loud clankig on the floor just above us like someone was hitting on a pipe with a hammer. I am a frequest Ritz guest, but this one just didn't have the "ah" factor. With all the choices in Miami, you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “construction noise spoiled our stay”
Reviews.Author: Cubs-never
Reviews.Content: Before I go into the details of our stay at the Ritz, I really want to know why $100/night hotels offer free parking, free breakfast, free wireless internet access, free business computer access and free local calls while a $455/night hotel like the Ritz charges $30/day for parking, expensive breakfasts, daily charges for wireless internet access, minute-by-minute charges for business computer access and a 99% overcharge on local calls? Now to our stay: the staff at the hotel were excellent, friendly and well trained; our room was excellent and clean; the location was within walking distance of the Cocowalk and a nice selection of restaurants; service was impectable. Now the not so good comments: we had a meal at the lobby restaurant the first night we were there and my wife's meal (pasta) was inedible (after we complained, we were not charged for it); the hotel was undergoing remodeling that involved constant noise from all sorts of power equipment during the 8AM to 5PM period and was loudly disturbing in our room, on our balcony and at the pool; the landscaping work was performed daily from about 9AM to 12PM around the pool area and involved the use of exceedingly noisy power equipment - one of the guests finally told the landscaper to stop and leave, which he did. We had to leave the hotel in order to get away from the noise even though our purpose of coming to this hotel was to finally obtain a week-long period of quiet relaxation in the Miami warmth by a pool. We complained to the hotel manager who was very apologetic and told us that he would like to think for a few hours to decide upon what he might be able to do to make sure that we wouldn't leave his hotel unhappy. About 4 hours later, he sent us a note offering us to receive a one night room upgrade the next time we would come to this hotel. We told him what he could do with this wonderful offer and we do not plan to ever come back to this hotel. We are very experienced travelers and only stay in 4 or 5 star hotels, but we neglected to determine if there was any construction going on in the hotel when we made our reservations - a mistake we will never make again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: KeysDreamin
Reviews.Content: This was not my favorite Ritz Carlton property, BUT, it was luxurious and well located in walking distance to Coconut Grove shops/restaurants. It is a bit sandwiched into its space, so does not have the open expansive feel in lobby and outside that many RC's have. But the roses in the lobby are gorgeous and the lobby bar, while small, was well used. The staff was excellent and the pool looked nice. Room was typical, with all marble bath, but with separate tub and shower. Room had a balcony with a water glimpse. While I wouldn't vacation here, I found it a lovely place to stay when passing through Miami for a night on the way to the Keys, and will stay again if I get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the Ritz - average for elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: querque1
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Ritz, but I regularly stay at hotels that are supposed to be in a similar class - W, Fairmont, JW Marriott, etc. Based on this stay I would not bother again. The hotel staff was extremely kind and diligent, but that was all that stood out. The in-room dining was sub-par and the food was cold both times I ordered. The Fitness Center was supposed to be 24-hours but they insisted cleaning with vacuums during my night workout. Also it didn't feel safe going to that area at night, so what's the point of being open 24 hours? The catered meals were poor, but I was there for a large conference and did not expect much more. The hotel was adjacent to a main shopping area but strangely you had to walk around the block to get there. This was inconvenient because the coffee was terrible, so I had to take a 15-minute walk each way to the closest external coffee shop. My room had trash in it when I arrived so I spent the rest of the time wondering whether cleaning was sufficient. Nothing terrible happened - if this had been a regular Marriott or Hampton Inn it would have all been fine - I just expected more for the cache and price of the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, under renovation”
Reviews.Author: madbaby
Reviews.Content: We fled to the Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove from the nearby Residence Inn (which was horrible) and were really happy with our stay. Service was fantastic, our room was large and clean, and we loved the hotel. It did feel like nobody else was there, and there was a lot of construction going on. The hotel restaurant was closed for dinner during the week, so we ate at the lobby bar, which was nice but not the same ambiance as a restaurant. Our server was perfect, though. We really enjoyed our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Eksplorerka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ritz-Carlton 3 nigths and we enjoyed our stay in that hotel. Adventages: -spacy room with amazing view. -very comfortable bed -shiny bathroom -courteous and nice staff -excellent food -heated, outdoor swimming pool -nearby there is a park with path for runner Disadvantages: -there was a renovation, when we stayed so was loudly from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m If you want eat outside the hotel I recommed to drive to Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “100% improvement”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsWoolfy
Reviews.Content: Posted a review last year, wasnt up to Ritz standard anyway got a good rate and went back, somethings happened as back to usual Ritz standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay!”
Reviews.Author: suze_shoes
Reviews.Content: Miami is not the easiest place to find a quiet, elegant place to stay. Look no further. If you are sailing out of Miami on a cruise, come down the day before and enjoy a nice stay at this lovely Ritz. Head to Rosa Mexicano via cab for dinner the evening before, and then hit Starbucks around the corner for a quick breakfast the next morning. Enjoyed a lovely lunch at the pool and cozy beds. Small rooms, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great in service and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PR-52
Reviews.Content: Great in service, very, very Clean, the staff are very friendly. Good Food and the personel in overoll is very nice. In the center of Coconut Groove.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jfdjr
Reviews.Content: Came to Miami for an athletic event on 10-30. Had some Ritz $s and decided to stay at this hotel for a couple of nights before moving up to Miami. The Ritz experience was great. Everybody goes to a great extent to make sure you are having a good stay. Every staff member from maid to porter to managers said 'hello' and inquired as to how your stay was and if there was anything about your room or other services you might need help with. I ate a continental breakfast in the restaurant and had 4 different people attending to me!! The rooms were wonderful. The pool is great -- big enough to swim laps in. The hotel is very close the the Coconut Grove waterfront and downtown area. I would definitely come back to this hotel. Look for packages. One night I was able to get a package that allowed free internet, free valet parking and free continental breakfast for only $ 20 over base room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & relaxing”
Reviews.Author: noasmom
Reviews.Content: My husband decided on a last minute vacation for Memorial Day weekend. Since we've been to the Four Seasons he booked the Ritz Carlton to try. As soon as you walk through the door you get the wonderful smell of roses. The lobby is decorated with gorgeous floral arrangments. The staff is unbelievably friendly. The lobby resteraunt has something for everyone. The pool area is clean and comfortable and luch was always great. The guestrooms were situated nicely with amazing bathrooms. My only negative comment is that the rooms do not have ample drawer space for your clothes. While it is large and beautiful, most of the drawers house the safe and minibar. We spent most of our time living out of our suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot experience not Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: angelina0926
Reviews.Content: This property has a nice feel to it, it is not very uptight like most Ritz Carltonâ€™s and overall the staff is helpful. With that said, the managers are nowhere to be found. My husband and I had some complaints due to the construction going on in the hotel which were not advised to us by the staff. We asked to speak to a manager and no one knew the where about of those individuals. We had Spa treatments as part of our American express packages and had great services with a gentlemen named Danilo and a nail appointment with Martha which was fantastic. Although the personnel providing the services were great, when we entered the spa there was no one there to greet us, we walked in to the lockers rooms and eventually found an older gentlemen who assisted us with locker keys. When we were done with the services and were ready to pay, same thing no one was at the front to assist us. My husband stepped outside to take a call while I was waiting. As my husband stepped outside a pencil that was hanging from the door fell, this noise was what advised the spa manager of our exit. I explained to Laura, the spa manager, that no one was there to greet us and that we were waiting for 10 minutes to check out. There was no apology and her over all demeanors was as if though she did not really care. I also noticed Laura was rushed to leave the spa because she had her purse hanging from her shoulder. This is obviously poor management to me and lack of service. Over all if you do not receive a good deal for the Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove youâ€™re better off staying at a Marriot you will probably receive better service and get a better bank for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “No I do not speak Spanish”
Reviews.Author: cold752
Reviews.Content: Is it common in Miami for the locals to assume you are hispanic? The valet attendant was nice but spoke little english and I doubt he understood everything I said. I went inside to check-in and the first greeting by the front desk agent was in spanish. Why? My husband said its probably because I look like Jennifer Lopez but I don't speak spanish. I have heard this sort of thing happens a lot in Miami but I was not expecting this at the Ritz. I politely ask the girl to please speak in english. Would you believe it the same thing happen later that day? Are there no longer any english speaking qualified individuals to work? Moving on, the staff was very nice overall and the service great but I notice that managers are no where to be found. Try it, ask for one and you will hear "..in a meeting.." We joked that maybe this is similar to the movie "The Associate" and the managers are ficitional. We had hope to speak with the executive chef because the food did not meet our expectation. The location is hidden somewhere in Miami Grove. We prefer the quietness and privacy Grove has to offer except when we woke up to loud hammer noise. Someone neglected to inform us during reservation that the hotel was undergoing renovation. Maybe the "managers" forgot that people actually come to hotels to find relaxation. I understand modernizing the hotel but at 9AM?!!! On our last night we decide to visit the pool, like my daughter would say, OMG! The only thing missing were barb wires. It was not a pretty sight. We found out the pool area is being renovated as well. Overall the service was great but the minor issues took away from what we expected to be a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice response”
Reviews.Author: kalamataPa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 6th visit to the Ritz Coconut Grove. We chose this hotel for fact that we have had excellent treatment and wonderful experiences in the past. This visit however we did encounter an unfortunate event; although unsettling at the time we were treated wonderfully and professionally when we raised our concern. William was very kind and made sure that he resolved our issue in a very timely manner; very professional! The staff from the housekeeping, restaurant, valet, front desk and management cannot be beat and we will continue to choose the Ritz for any upcoming stay in Coconut Grove. You will feel well respected and very happy with your choice to stay at this lovely property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: tani267
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly charming hotel. Definitely not for the party animals looking for action in south beach... the area is quiet but a short stroll away a really nice village where you can eat outside & very nice shops etc. I checked in after long flight from London & met William... I cannot emphasise enough what a great young man. He's whole demeanor is calm, relaxing, welcoming, friendly and he is a real asset to this hotel. I travel a lot & rarely have I come across a guy like this. I'm sure he's going to go very far in his career coz he has a way in dealing & speaking to people that is a real gift. The rooms are lovely, nothing too special but once you're all tucked up you cannot fault a single thing, great bed very high quality/thread count sheets, bathroom just amazing. They give you so much water and it's a small cost to the hotel but goes a long way with travellers. TV flat screen, room service excellent. Had the brunch on Sunday morning and though it seems a small selection, it's only because they are not putting out gallons of food: rather they refresh it constantly & it was fab-u-lous! Topping you up with free champs all morning. Nice gym, nice bar area, the only gripe would be swimming pool. They need to address this area: The chairs were more from a 3* hotel. I'd recommend this hotel hands down... ended up extending my stay I was so relaxed couldn't move! On way back home I tried Four Seasons::: which is perfectly nice but the Ritz is far more relaxing, intimate & friendly. I also visited the Ritz at South Beach & it's a monster of a hotel -- huge but the staff were lovely & it's bang on the beach. Ritz Coconut Grove is more boutique & everyone without exception makes u feel special. I found the staff in the dining room more than attentive so I was amazed anyone would complain about being kept waiting. Concierge - can't remember her name but she's from kenya - gave me great tips & even told me about a place to get the best pancakes I've had in a gizillion years! Stay & u won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “So Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz before we took a cruise on RCI. It was a very affordable package which included parking and breakfast. Great deal. Of course the hotel was very upscale. It was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The large room had a baconey with a view of downtown MIami. Very comfortable king bed, large flat screen tv, crown molding and very large bathroom. Separate walk in shower and tub. Plenty of plush towels. Coco walk is a 5 minute walk with lots of places to eat and shops to go into. Ate at the Cheescake Factory for the first time, very crowded and I now know why. The food was excellent. Staff are all very pleasant and the hotel was spotless. When you enter the lobby it is full of flowers so the smell is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Some things are out of your control, STAFF shouldnt be!!”
Reviews.Author: drgoblue73
Reviews.Content: When you think of the Ritz Carlton, you think of opulence. I expect grandiose settings and beautiful arrangements. As far as Coconut Grove is concerned, the actual building has it, unfortunately they're located in an area that takes away from it. It's placed oddly on what seems to be a side-business traveler street BEHIND the only important part of the Grove!! As a matter of fact, if you go about 3 turns in the wrong direction, it would be in your best interest to roll up your windows and lower your radio.... This is out of their control so I cannot fault them. The hotel itself is gorgeous and very classy. Only a few gripes.... - Food prepared correctly once every 8 times - The one time the food is prepared correctly, it will take so long to get to you, you might as well start take a look around and see what hotel guest you're going to eat first to survive. - Pool under renovation and it didn't say it on the website - BUT it was still open thankfully - Language barrier with some of the staff which makes them seems standoff-ish or surly. - Managers speak less English than the floor employees Pros - Housekeeping works harder than most. Room in always in immaculate condition after mid-day service -You're close to South Beach = close to the sun, sand and beautiful women - pricing is very affordable - Lastly, employees like William Baines. The guy is spot-on with everything he does for you. He was able to assist me in whatever I needed while i was there. Kind-hearted, focused, and a genuine person. He even played a better concierge than the ACTUAL concierge. Had an issue with my bill and he was able to fix it right away. William was absolutely great and if i didn't know any better, I'd say he lived there because he was in the lobby or behind the desk everytime I came down! If you're there ask for him!! I doubt you'll be disappointed in the service. All in all, a great stay....kudos to housekeeping and Mr. Baines. If you like elegant and quaint, go with this Ritz. Just remember to pack your own lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Really good, not great but really good...”
Reviews.Author: tumbler989
Reviews.Content: 1st class staff, all the service and amenities you'd expect from a RC property. Smaller than most Ritz Carlton's, good location to spend a day in the Grove. Excellent fitness area, nice pool. Dining options were nice - breakfast was good. All in all, an excellent four star property but you'd expect a little more for five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gatorcane
Reviews.Content: If you are a couple 40 plus coming to Miami this is perfect. The property and staff are outstanding. The spa with Laura and Erica are lovely. A massage with Danny will spoil you for other massage therapists. He is intuitive, kind and a real expert. The rooms and food will not disappoint. The area is a dream. Directly across the street is a large, beautiful marina. There are several casual restaurants and a great gourmet market. There are three parks for picnics, a cushioned running trail all on Biscayne Bay. Boat rentals for cruising, fishing are available. Just a short, easy, three minute walk into town for a brand new thirteen movie theater with the latest hits. Many restaurants such as Jaguars for Peruvian, Georges for French and a good, funky sports bar the Sand bar(try the Joey wings). The Grove will easily take up three days. Stroll through the art stores, picnic, boat, see a movie and dine around. When you are finished drive or better take a taxi to South Beach 20 minutes. Do the typical beach, drink, eat, shop. A younger crowd will enjoy staying on South Beach but you can still head over there for the experience while returning to the home town charm of the Grove. From the Grove location another 10 minute cab ride away is Coral Gables with the elegant Merrick Park shops and more dining on Miracle Mile. You can get to Miracle Mile on a free trolly and catch a taxi from there back to the Ritz in the Grove. Overall I found it to be a centrally located area (20-30 minutes from airport) and an excellent jumping off point for so many locales. A car will not be needed unless Key West ( 3 hours) or the Zoo (1 hour) are on your agenda.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: MeredithS
Reviews.Content: My room was extremely comfortable. It was quiet. The breakfast buffet was excellent and allowed me to get an early start to my day. The service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Just "okay" -- nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BizProf
Reviews.Content: While the hotel met the standards, there was nothing exceptional here. The staff were very friendly and accommodating but made many little mistakes that just shouldn't happen in a hotel of this quality. The room service was friendly but with mistakes AND the food was mediocre. I stayed here for a conference and it certainly met my minimum expectations but didn't dazzle me. In other words, I wouldn't stay here if I were paying!

Reviews.Title: “So near but also so far in many ways..”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove, which is about 30 minutes drive from South Beach. And having stayed there a second time, I now remember why I was in two minds about it and staying here when I had the option of hotels in the area. Like most Ritz Carltonâ€™s it is fairly costly to stay here, so for me here is a summary of the good and the bad: The positives The rooms are large and a good size, with very comfortable beds and pillows and large well equipped bathroom. But based on the location in the middle of a suburban area many have very unappealing views for the price. I was looking over to buildings and a roof top. The Fitness centre is large and well equipped The reception and front lobby service is very friendly and helpful. I had, for example, on checking in asked for a room without an inter-leading door to another one, and they handle it in a no fuss and open way. The negatives It is not in South Beach, which may sound odd but is important if you are on holiday or (like I was) attending a conference at the Miami Conference Center, as if you are planning or needed to spend in SoBe this location is not ideal. There is nothing much around the hotel, and you will need a car. The service and time it takes to get breakfast in the restaurant is very slow, versus the fast evening room service The overall attention to detail through the hotel is mixed, I had asked for my bathroom scales to be changed twice and neither worked, and you think that they would have at least have tried to ensure that the replacement worked. When booking, check you get a deal that has the valet parking and the breakfast included as they are expensive as extras. So overall it is a neat, up-market hotel that does a lot well but lacks some of the depth that other 5 star hotels offer. So close but just misses.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel for Super Bowl”
Reviews.Author: roadwillie
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was among the best I have ever experienced. The Sunday buffet was great. The hotel was very clean and the rates were affordable

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business Travel, Not Quite Up to Par for Ritz Brand”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very nice and friendly staff, but service was not quite up to par overall for the Ritz 5-star brand. Housekeeping was inconsistent, restaurant was closed most of visit, and a few little things like toiletries were not usual luxe brands associated with 5-star hotels. I saw a few reviewers below commented it felt like a Marriott and while I can't say it was that below the bar, it wasn't up to par with most other Ritz properties I've stayed at. I did not use the pool but it looked a bit old, nothing beautiful about it but I'm sure it does the job when it's hot and sunny. What I LIKED was how beautiful the hotel was, our meeting rooms were lovely and service in that regard was great. Fitness center was awesome and little spa was nice - got a good massage. If I did need anything, it was addressed, just not always up to super standards associated with Ritz. I would not come here for a getaway with my honey. But if you're looking for a good hotel that's in Miami area, near airport but still near beach, is upscale and comfortable, and has friendly attentive staff, and especially for business travel, this is one I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Besides some staff, fairly average”
Reviews.Author: phDTanzy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a very odd area of coconut grove. Not much to do within the general vicinity. Food service PAINSTAKINGLY slow!!! Menu not very creative but food was well prepared. Never saw any managers oround when in need of help and/or had questions. Staff seemed a little light and overworked but may just have been a slow week. William at the Front Desk was extememly knowledgable, always very kind and what seems like one of the few great assets they have. Katherine and Jeanette very accommodating as well.....Always smiling. Nothing to rave home about but far from bad.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsWoolfy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a few Ritz Carltons, but im afraid the service at this one is zero. Rooms great and clean but after that forget it, our main problems were as follows. They ran out of Regular Coffee for the room and milk We started off with two bath robes between three of us and requested another, we ended up with one robe as laundry was late and our second one had gone to a suite. Breakfast forget it. 40 mins for granola and a bagel and costs the earth. No free wifi, this should be the norm by now. Gym, ok but the water machine cooler had ran empty and after a long run found this really annoying. Ended up going to the bar for a jug of milk so we could make our own coffee which we bought from the store and had an argument with the barman as he was trying to charge us. Came back at the begining of Jan 2010 and emailed them the above comments, no reply so thought better post on Trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “not a ritz , must be a plain marriott”
Reviews.Author: firstclassflyer007
Reviews.Content: we were in january booked for 3 day thru amex platinum , bkf included an upg of room and a extra amenities, Bkf average ( weird for a ritz ), bad service , all the waitress are very tired,coming like doing a favor to us, No Upg , just given a bay view, you re 4 blocks from the bay (pooor), and the worst is the extremely unfriendly front desk staff. There is no distinctives little touches , clasically at a ritz property, located in a old part of miami (coconut groove ) be a long way from the basic miami things to do like south beach , malls , decents restaurants etc... BTW coconut walk was years ago a nice place to walk with cafes and shops , now nothing of this , closed shops everywhere, no people waking just a few cafes and rest. Ok im an architecht , so i describe the building like an old style way of construction,it not seems an hotel from outside,just a old residences one, very hiden and confussed entrance ,lobby sub par , regular rooms a little tired , similar to all common parts of the building,there is no complementary internet service in anywhere , but there is a bussines center with two computers...,of course you must paid 15 dollars for an hour , what do you think about that ?????. In the rooms there is a lower quality ritz branded shampoo ,conditioner and soap , what is this ??????????? we stay at many ritz around the world and is the very first time we find this ,ritz is common to bulgary, hermes or l occitanne products. No slipers , we must requested 4 times , on the last day they appears , woow all in all its must be ok when the company paid for that ...... , or, you paid a hudred and something, but when the people paid over 350 p-night you must be required a really RITZ CARLTON experience not a fake like this . do not recomended this hotel to anyone, do it yorself a favor and go to somewhere else,there a lot of high end properties and very new ones on brickel ave, like four seasons, epic, viceroy , mandarin oriental,and more,more,more,fabulous places to eat, near to downtown ,bayside and the beaches ,all for the same price or below

Reviews.Title: “Its A Marriot not a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: MGRAPT
Reviews.Content: The product has a good structure mainly for corp. accounts Service is very weak except for some great people at front desk Waiting time at breakfast or bar is a life time Room cleaning is average If you are looking for a Ritz Carlton service forget it !! at best its like a Marriot or Sheraton This hotel should with the current service should be re branded as its only damaging it image and giving room to Four Seasons!!

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed - a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TM99
Reviews.Content: First off, I had previously stayed at this property soon after it had opened (6 years ago)and had enjoyed my stay. We chose the RC Coco Grove this trip, as I didn't want to stay at South Beach and wanted a change from Key Biscayne. The suite in this hotel was fine, the doorman MOST obliging and the Chamber Maids and Room Service also provided perfectly acceptable service. However the restaurant (we tried it twice - Christmas Lunch and the next morning for breakfast when we walked out after not being served after ONE hour) is DIRE with such appalling service that words fail me! The restaurant manager was useless and spent most of his time hiding! The waiting staff do not give a [-]! The entire hotel was very quiet (over Christmas) and the atmosphere was one of a sinking ship. This property is poorly managed at the top and we won't be going back. As an aside we visited the Mandarin Oriental (for dinner - which was wonderful at Azul) and this was warm, welcoming and an enitrely different (and superior) proposition. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “For business, maybe. For leisure, definitely not.”
Reviews.Author: sweetmags
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, but the service was terrible and not up to the Ritz standard that we've experienced anywhere else. We will never stay here again nor will we recommend that anyone stay here. First, it took them 3 hours to prepare our room upon our arrival. We were put in a temporary room so we could rest, but calls to the concierge to follow up on the status of our permanent room were never returned. Second, since this hotel is not close to a beach we were hoping for a nice pool, but sandwiched between buildings it was depressing at best. Also, aside from an outdoor mall of the Cheesecake Factory variety, Coconut Grove has nothing going on. So we were stuck--the hotel wasn't a place we wanted to hang around in and neither was Coconut Grove. As a result, we called the concierge to find out if we could use the facilities at another nearby Ritz during the day. We were told it would be no problem. So we spent $60 to take a taxi to the other property, only to find out that it was indeed a problem. We managed to finagle our way onto that property, but were pretty irritated that the Ritz got it wrong. Third, (a small issue but after the first two our fuses were pretty short) we were given wrong directions to a restaurant. We spent half an hour walking in the wrong direction based on the Ritz instructions. Fourth, we were charged a "room service fee" when my husband went downstairs to procure a glass of milk. That's just ridiculous. Fifth, after our irritation we asked the Ritz to call another hotel to find out about availability. Our call was warmly received, but no one ever bothered to call us back with a follow up. Finally, we made our own reservations at another hotel and went down to the manager to explain why we would be checking out early. When he asked what he could do, we suggested that he could comp our valet parking charge. Although he agreed, when our bill arrived the next morning, the valet parking charge was at the very top of the list of charges (along with internet fees which was odd since we didn't have a computer). While all of this was ultimately resolved, it was such a detraction from our vacation that we left feeling very angry.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking room?”
Reviews.Author: bluebutterfly59
Reviews.Content: My company booked a room for me at the Ritz for 3 days. I checked in a sized room but i think the previous guest smoked in that room. Otherwise the bathroom was well sized, a very nice new flat screen TV and the staff was okay as well. I would stay here again, but the next time i make sure i get into a no smoking room. Perfect location, the next time i will stay here for vacation and not for work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel with uneven service”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days & found the staff to be extremely friendly. However, the service was a little uneven: paper not always delivered, towels not always at pool in early morning (8 am), restaurant hostess either overly solicitous or ignoring you while you wait in a vitryally empty restaurant for a table, bartender not knowing a lick about wine (including how much to pour into the glass). We upgraded rooms for a direct bay view from the top floor (only 8th floor, as condos occupy the rest of the tower). Strangely enough the housekeeping standard also changed: much better towels & more amenities (slippers, etc.). None of these items detracted from our stay, especially since the staff was genuinely very friendly. however, it was a little surprising for a Ritz-Carlton. Perhaps the service standards are a little different in South Florida (also found that service in the Miami Mandarin Oriental wasn't quite up to par with other mandarin hotels I've visited).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: efeeney
Reviews.Content: My party of 12 arrived at the Ritz hotel on Friday 11th September 2009 after having a big problem with a rental property we were intending on staying in and having my wedding at. Upon check in the reception staff were extremely welcoming and pleasant. My mother briefly explained our situation and upon entering my room one of the reception staff knocked on my door and explained that they would like to offer for us to have our wedding at the hotel complimentary. This was an amazing gesture and one I am truely thankful for. We then met with Jeysa who was a dream to work with and considering our time scale (5 days)managed to turn my our wedding day into one I could only have dreamed of. All the staff at the hotel were wonderful and the service is the best I have ever had, and all of my party were in agreement. I would also like to pay a special mention to Jorge round the pool who was so friendly and helpful but not in annoying not let you do anything for youself kind of way, a pleasure to talk to every day. Thank you all so much for making our stay and wedding wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Adrian Loveridge
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel plays their part in making you feel special and its difficult to fault anything. Our package (Peace of Mind) included daily American breakfast, but what they don't tell you (until you check-in) is that there is a maximum credit of $22 per day. There is no buffet so you have to order off an a la carte menu and either stay within the $22 or pay any difference. I found this a little nit-picking and frankly reflects badly on a 5 star hotel. The ONLY other criticism was the restaurant where breakfast was served, considering the location, had no view. You could have been anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “value for money.”
Reviews.Author: rilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the executive suite and it was spacious and had a very good decor. There were two bathrooms which were also good. The only criticism I had was that the air con did not work properly in the main bedroom despite us telling the staff about it. On the whole though this is a very nice hotel and staying in Coconut Grove is alot more peaceful then staying in South Beach. Better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and elegant stay - Great hotel , excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Alstromeria33
Reviews.Content: I was there on business for a conference. I found this hotel classy , elegant which is usually a combination of the premices , the staff and the clientele. The atmosphere was relaxed and classy. My favorite. Very nice lobby, very helpful concierge nice pool (not a resort pool, but nicer pool than typical for city hotel), good room with excellent bathroom, nice balcony. Service was excellent. This is partly a hotel and partly a RC residence. I was not too fond of the building itself (I prefer lower structures) , but the inside (rooms, lobby, restaurants, pool) compensated nicely. Coconut Grove will not keep you busy more than a couple of hours or for diner. It is a "quiet" place. Miami beach is kilometers away. Personnally I like these places, near the hot places, but not in the middle of it. So this hotel is perfect from that perspective. If you like your shopping, befores and afters at the foot of the hotel ... search for another place.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Podgorica21
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't be able to afford it most times - but it was a good deal on Expedia and my birthday treat. The only gripe I would have is the cost of the aprking and the charge for internet - but I guess if you have to worry about such things you shouldn't really be in the Ritz Carlton in the first place!

Reviews.Title: “It was hard not to feel like royalty. We had excellent service from the moment we arrived.”
Reviews.Author: mielebug
Reviews.Content: The service at the Ritz-Carlton in Coconut Groce was excellent. The front desk was more than accomodating. When we asked for help they went above and beyond. Our room was gorgeous with a view of the bay. Every dettail of the room was perfect when we walked in. It had everything we needed, was very clean, and was at a perfect temperature. Nothing can beat the relaxing "imagine" music video that plays on the television in the room. It took only seconds to feel like I was truely on vacation. The breakfast offered in the hotel restaurant was delicious. When we wanted to leave the hotel there was so much to do just a few steps away. We enjoyed walking to the restaurants and bars just blocks away from the hotel. There is nothing I didn't like about staying at the Ritz-Carlton in Coconut Grove other than the fact that I couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Elegance”
Reviews.Author: slimK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Ritz Carlton in the grove. Cannot say enough about the staff, Fatima and Ashley were ever so accommodating. Rooms are well decorated and the bathroom is extremely spacious. Pool area is immaculate with all the amenities one would hope to find. If you are looking for a first class hotel without an "attitude" then I would strongly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: cracerx25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The service was incredible, the rooms were spotless (with turn down service twice daily). The view from the balcony was great, The front desk personnel was very friendly and willing to assist with any request. This is not South Beach, but there is access to some great high-end chain restaurants blocks away at Coco Walk and access to major roads leading to the beaches. If you want a clean, elegant, high-end experience without the bad attitudes that South Beach has to offer, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Miami for discerning adults”
Reviews.Author: El_Viajero_Global
Reviews.Content: Having disliked the Impala, South Beach last year (see review), I stumbled upon this excellent alternative which, for anyone who wants Miami sans tackiness, is a great choice. Booked on the R-C website with a "reconnect" package which gives you a $200 credit to offset against the "extras"; the room was $300+ for the first night dropping to $200 for the subsequent three - tax extra. As a Viajero Global who has just turned 50, I've grown out of the full-on South Beach experience - in addition to which, THE thing seems to be conversion of hotel bars into night clubs which renders the hotel stay for anyone not participating in the party scene horrible. Fortunately, the R-C CG treats its guests as adults and the whole experience is one of friendly (but not over-friendly) attention to detail. My 4-night stay could have been designed as the perfect "test": > After putting my clothes in the closet, I found a sticky mess on the shelf which had soiled a shirt; in a matter of minutes, housekeeping sent a guy and a girl to clean it. > They said I should leave the shirt to be laundered the following day which I did but past the cut-off time for same-day delivery; nevertheless, the charming lady who picked it up asked me whether I would like it delivered the same day. > I was initially allocated room 817 which has a door to an adjoining room; as I discovered on the second day, this means you hear absolutely everything from the guests next door so I asked if I could change. This was no problem and I was allocated 720 which was bigger (with no connecting door) but without access to an external free WiFi available from 817. The laundered shirt was duly delivered the same day to 720. > The cost for the laundered shirt appeared on the bill but was removed immediately I pointed it out. > The $200 credit was NOT fully applied to the bill on checkout (the guy at the desk said they had complained about the systems glitch) but was deducted straightaway. Other observations: > The large pool is lovely and peaceful: receives the sun after 11.30am at this time of year. > I found service superb throughout the property: as others have mentioned, it's amazing they remember your name without it seeming fake; if you hablar espaÃ±ol, the housekeeping staff are incredibly friendly. > As a "solo traveller", I didn't feel out of place since a) the average age of the guests is older and b) it's used by people on business which gives it less of a suffocating "straight couples only" atmosphere. > You definitely need a car (Coconut Grove is nice but you'll definitely want to go to the malls or other areas of Miami): hiring from Avis at MIA took 45 minutes so I'll try Hertz next time. Valet parking is $30 per night but very efficient. One of my all-time favourite hotels is the Sukhothai, Bangkok and the R-C, CG provides a similar metropolitan hotel experience and will be my base for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Please Avoid”
Reviews.Author: vacances
Reviews.Content: This is the third Ritz in the last year that I've stayed at. Both the ones in Sarasota and Grand Cayman were MUCH better....no comparison. First of all, there is NOTHING to do in Coconut Grove. There were no interesting shops or any nice stores. If you must be in this area, I would try to find a nice hotel in the South Beach area, about 20 minutes south. As for this Hotel, the Housekeeping department is a complete disaster. They have no clue how to prepare, clean, or maintain a room! When I checked in, almost everything was missing....from toiletries to towels to the crib we requested for my newborn. They "forgot" to do the turn down service 3 of the 4 nights we were there. When they did clean the room, it was still dirty! The toilets had brown streaks, the sheets had stains, and the corners of the room had little dustballs as if it hadn't been vacuumed in weeks. Whenever I would complain, the manager said we are looking into it and we would get back to you! Of course, I never heard a thing back. I couldn't believe it. I thought staying at a Ritz Carlton meant amazing service and all the perks you don't get at a lower hotel chain. I will never return here and pray that you don't make the same mistake. Oh, by the way, worst massage I ever had at their spa and the pool area is really not nice with once again, terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Expect From a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: sjordan14
Reviews.Content: After a last minute change in plans, our trip to Key West had to be aborted and we ended up heading back to the Miami area. With no advance planning, we aimed for the nearest available Ritz and found our way to Coconut Grove. We've stayed at a number of the different Ritz locations and were very happy with what we found when we arrived. This is one of the smaller Ritz hotels. It is down right tiny compared to its bigger sister resort on Key Biscayne. But the smaller size results in a much friendlier and personal experience. We were looking for a quiet and luxurious stay and that's exactly what we got. The room was very nice with a beautiful balcony view of the Bay with Key Biscayne in the distance. By comparison to other Ritz hotels, the room is slightly smaller, but every bit as comfortable and clean. We arrived late afternoon and were happy to find 24 hour room service. As usual, the room service food was delivered promptly and it was a delicious meal on the balcony enjoying the sun and the breeze with a great view. Breakfast room service was equally good. Did not have a chance to visit the restaurant, but we were told that it was excellant as well. The pool area is quite nice and very quiet. We enjoyed the pool bar and the chance to sit outside in the sun and enjoy a late afternoon cocktail. During our visit, the young man at the bar was very friendly, but not very experienced on preparing drinks.
