(Didn't know what a Rum Punch was, we made some quick changes on our choices and got him thru the items he wasn't familiar with. The staff was very helpful to a person. The staff at the front desk was quick to recommend where to go for meals outside the hotel as well as how to get there. There wasn't a request that they didn't immediately respond to quickly and with a smile. Coconut Grove was very quiet and very disappointing. The descriptions we read before we arrived made it sound like a charming shopping area full of interesting boutiques. Sadly, didn't find that to be the case. Instead, found very boring shops with lots of empty and closed locations. Don't know if this is all a result of the bad economy, but nothing worth seeing. Downtown Coral Gables (Miracle Mile) also turned out to be disappointing compared to the descriptions. Bottom line - excellent hotel that should not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel---Not Quite a Resort---Not Quite an Elegant City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iowaguy
Reviews.Content: We had a 24-hour stay at the Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove on Valentines Day 2009 after a trip to Caribbean. It was a nice hotel---good lobby, nice pool (not quite a resort pool, but nicer pool than typical for city hotel), good room with excellent bathroom, nice balcony. Service was excellent. Accommodated very early check-in nicely. Asked an employee where the pool was and he spent 5 minutes walking with us until we got there. Food at pool bar was good as was dinner at Vizcaya. Note: This is partly a hotel and partly a RC residence. At the pool it was mostly residents who knew each other that lived in residential tower. Not a bad thing--just different. I wasn't just crazy about Coconut Grove but thats an issue of personal preference. I do prefer South Beach. It was a very good hotel overall, but I only give it 4 stars rather than 5 stars because I do not think this hotel quite has a clear vision of what it is. The amenities (pool, etc.) are not quite up to high-end resort standards, and its not quite up to Ritz Carlton standards for the urban hotels. Still, it suited our needs well, and we had a very pleasant short stay here. Would not hesitate to return for a short Miami visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience & Surprisingly Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: chappyvt
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! From the minute I arrived, the staff at the Ritz-Carlton treated me as if I was the only guest in the hotel. They continuously used my name which made me feel like a VIP!! We were able to get the room at an absolute stealâ€¦.booked a package called Reconnect. We got breakfast; valet and internet for an absolutely amazing price (canâ€™t believe it from the Ritz)! The hotel has new rooms that were extremely clean with fresh flowers in the room! Downtown Coconut Grove was just steps away with great restaurants and live entertainment!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely elegant”
Reviews.Author: PeterBToronto
Reviews.Content: As you might expect from the price, this is an first! class hotel in every respect. Service is fabulous; rooms are gorgeous (though not all that large); it has every facility imaginable. The hotel is in a quiet area near the marina and there are a few stores in the area, though not really ideal for much shopping. Two complaints: $30 per day for parking is exorbitant considering the price per night. My wife was on her own one evening and went down to the bar; she ordered a bowl of soup, It was terrible, like one of those dehydrated soup mixes. (OK, high speed Ineternet should be free of charge too.) Otherwise, this is a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc_t08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Caters more to business travel but courteous helpful service, spacious rooms. We stayed just for 1 night and it fit our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Ritz I've ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: seegeeme
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff was very nice and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable although my double room was a little cramped. The valet service is slow slow slow. Even when I had called down to have my car brought up and allowed 10 minutes to go downstairs, I still waited 5 minutes. And most of the time, when I was arriving and leaving the hotel over 4 days, there was no one there to even open the door. One time I had my hands full when leaving the hotel, there were 2 staff people at the conceirge desk looking at me struggling with the door and no one came to help. Not impressed. The food was dreadful! Expensive and terrible. I ate at the restaurant downstairs and room service . Had a pasta dish at Bizcaya the first night that was inedible. Breakfast came with cold chewy toast ( nothing special bread). I've stayed at Ritz Carltons in Beverly Hills, Atlanta, Boston, Chicago....... the Coconut Grove Hotel needs some attention from management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: Justtravels988
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RC Coconut Grove this weekend before a flight from MIA. I've only visited Miami a few times but never this area. The hotel is only about 8 miles from MIA in a quaint- nice neighborhood. The hotel seems perfect for small events/ meetings/ weekend trips. Beautiful lobby and city pool area. I had confirmed (and was guaranteed) two double beds on arrival. We left Palm Beach around 7:30 and arrived to the hotel around 9pm and upon check in, were told that we would have to take a king w/ a roll away. I understand this happens, but it's obnoxious. Furthermore, we got a room that wasn't in turn down (seems odd for a Ritz- especially when they don't give you the room you confirmed). No amenity, no apology, just the king room. Regardless, CG has nice outdoor restaurants and the hotel is very relaxing/ retreat like. Our room had a nice balcony overlooking the bay and I hit the pool in the AM before our flight. We had a nice breakfast in the hotel restaurant (typical nice ritz style). Overall, nice place---wish they would have given us the room we guaranteed or an upgrade/ amenity for the hassle---but I'd go back (only if i needed a king room). Perfect for couples/ family weekends/ etc in Miami w/o the hassle or "scene" in South Beach. Also very close to shopping in Merrick Park/ Coral Gables.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnatus1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights for a combination of business and a weekend getaway. I was extremely happy with the hotel. The rooms were as clean, well decorated, and comfortable as you would expect. The service was very good - staff were always there when you needed them but without hovering. I think that is the epitome of good service... always there but never annoyingly so. Business services at the hotel were good. Breakfast and lunch catered to the our location was excellent. The conference rooms were good (if not a little over air-conditioned), and the wifi was fine. Word of warning: The Coconut Grove bar/shopping/restaurant area is within walking distance, but that isn't much of a destination. To get to beaches or high-end shopping, you definitely need to have a car. If you don't want to drive and you want a beach, perhaps the Ritz in South Beach is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: muija
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for two nights before a cruise. Taxi from the airport cost $25 (with tip). The hotel was situated in a rather quiet neighbourhood in Coconut Grove, not very much to see around there if you didn't have a car. CocoWalk with some shopping and restaurants was about 10 minutes walk away. The hotel itself was very comfortable, with some beautiful rooms. I specially liked the lobby area with bar, you can get some reasonably priced snacks and lighter meals there. The pool area was almost empty every morning, no problems getting lounge chairs there. Our room was comfortable with lots of pillows on the bed and posh Bvlgari-toiletries in the bathroom. Bathrobes were also a nice touch. We ate breakfast at the hotel both mornings, not cheap but good food and polite service. I would recommend this hotel for a relaxing stay away from the hustle and bustle of the South Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Staff”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after a cruise and had a wonderful experience. The thing that stood out the most was the helpfulness of the staff. We arrived very early, 10am, and they were able to find us a room so we didn't have to wonder around all day. The room was very nice and the pool area above average. I found the price to be reasonable for a hotel of this quality. A definite hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Landlocked”
Reviews.Author: Tagalong71
Reviews.Content: It's hard to criticize a Ritz, they are always some level of nice, but RCCG misses the mark a bit. Service felt a bit "green." The girl at the front desk who checked us in was borderline unprofessional. Definitely not polished. Not the typical RC over the top hospitality. Was at the pool about 6 hours without being asked if I needed/wanted anything. Usually at the Ritz they have someone going around handing out drinks, menus and sometimes even "freebies" like popsicles, etc. (my favorite). Rooms were fine, typical. Only downside was you could not open doors or sit on the balcony because of all the street noise/construction going on outside. Gym was fine, typical. Property itself felt suffocating. Our room did not have a view of the water and no where on the property could I find a view of anything. High walls seem to surround the property and it's outdoor areas. It is what it is, hotel is not on the water, so views are going to be limited but I feel the hotel could work with this. The pool was stark. Lots of cement and no flowers/water features, anything to soften the coldness of the cement. Also, lots of street and construction noise at pool. Piped in music would have been nice. Oh, and the food. Breakfast seemed less expensive than most RCs. Breakfast was not bad. Lunch prices were about the same as other RCs. Was VERY disapointed in the grilled fish sandwich. Dry, bland. awful. I wasn't looking for South Beach but Coconut Grove is a little tired. Next time I'll go back to Key Biscayne RC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as good as other locations”
Reviews.Author: alexanddeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned to stay at the Ritz South Beach for 3 nights starting the Sunday of Memorial Day. Luckily, a friend warned us about a hip hop festival on South Beach, and after confirming the atmosphere with the conierge at that hotel (bad news), we decided to move to the Rtiz Coconut Grove. I am not sure who would be best to stay there. It's a lovely property, with good service, and if you like Coconut Grove, then this would work. The hotel is steps away from all kinds of night life, but has little life itself. The pool area is rather concrete, and being that the ocean is near, it seems wrong to not be able to see the sea! The rooms are nice, and all else is as you would expect from a Ritz, but there isn't much atmosphere in the hotel. The staff were kind when we said we'd rather take our chances on the beach, so we switched (via the Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts program) to the Ritz South beach for the last 2 days, and missed the worst of the hip hop festival. One warning. There is a Sunday brunch in the only restaurant (other than the pool grill). We get a free lunch during our stay, as part of our Amex program, so we went ahead and lunched (brunched) at the hotel. I am a vegetarian, so ate little of the mainly fish and meat offerings. It's an extensive buffet, and as it was our only choice that day at the hotel, we ate. We couldn't believe it when the bill came. $175!!! No joke. Ok, we didn't ask the price, but assumed the usual hotel fee for brunch, $40-50. We had NO ALCOHOL and it was $175!! We did get credited our program rebate of $85, after explaining to the front desk that we had no other "lunch" choice. But still......

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money-Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: HurricaneDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Memorial Day Weekend at the Ritz-Carlton, believing that our hotel stay would be deserving of the five star rating the hotel has received. Boy, were we wrong! I want to begin by saying that the staff are courteous and friendly and the rooms are nicely decorated, but I receive the same at any Marriott that I have travelled to and that is quite often. To begin with, our room was suppose to have two double beds as booked, but the hotel put three of us in a room with a king bed and insisted that the reservation was based on this selection. We did get a roll-away for the third adult in our party, but it was quite uncomfortable and the hotel, oversold, was unable to provide an alternative room. Simple things like coffee cups and enough towels were never in the room and calls requesting same went unheeded. Parking is $30.00/day, valet only. One night, I stood around for 15 minutes after pulling up to the hotel for one of three attendants who were engrossed in conversation to finally acknowledge my presence. Don't get me wrong, I would expect something like this from a Motel 6, but the Ritz? The hotel reduced my daily rate to compensate me for the eventful weekend, but one should never expect this kind of service from a five star hotel. Do yourself a favor, stay at the Marriott. You will be alot happier and will have saved a bundle!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersfromCT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to do a last minute getaway to Miami and a family member recommended the Ritz as a great place to stay. We were very excited to make reservations there, the hotel was full via their website but we were able to get in at a very good rate via AA vacations. com. After booking the trip but before going to Miami, I purused Trip Advisor to see what people thought. Lots of negative reviews and I approached our hotel stay with trepidation and shared that with the staff as I registered at arrival. Well, nothing was farther from the truth! We had an absolutely fantastic time at this hotel! We were greeted with open arms, came in relatively later in the evening and were greeted in our room with a spectacular food platter full of fruit cheeses, and chocolates. Delicious! Our room was great, the staff was great, pool area was great. Also used the fitness center which was fabulous. Concierge service was excellent. They gave us great restaurant recommendations. Rooms looked brand new, great bed and balcony was wonderful. Very quiet spot which my husband and I loved. The Ritz has a high quality service ethic. I was by the pool and left my i touch (value of $350) by the pool and after we went back to our room we got a call from the staff at the pool saying they had my i touch and they brought it back to our room. I thought that was extremely classy. I would highly recommend this hotel. We are baby boomer travelers and I think this was perfect for our needs and the price was relatively reasonable compared to the expensive South Beach hotels. We are frequent travelers around the world so we have seen many hotels and many Ritz's If you are visiting the Miami area, stay there! You will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: KAB4375
Reviews.Content: We tried to stay here after a cruise to the Bahamas. We when arrived we found out that the pool was closed for emergency repairs. They explained that they could shuttle us over to their sister property on Key Biscayne to use the pool. We asked what time we would be picked up they told us 5. It was already 11am and the property was 45 minutes away. We asked if we could have our reservation transfered to the other site at the same price. They told us no. There was nothing that they could do. I ended getting into a fight with another worker at the front desk about the price of the sister property. Nice huh!. I did win the fight BTW. In the end we paid about $150 more a night and all the comped us was parking. What to go out of your way..not. Would never stay at a Ritz's again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but don't blow your life savings here!”
Reviews.Author: jsutcliffe2
Reviews.Content: although it is not in my nature, I will keep this brief. This hotel is good, and we enjoyed our time here. However, many of the fittings are more in line with the hotel's Marriott sister. The lobby is mediocre, and the reception staff a little dim. The rooms however, are pretty well proportioned with the usual refinements. A must during your stay is the afternoon tea, An excellent way to spend the afternoon. There are always pompous idiots in the lobby, wearing school ties, preppy loafers, talking nonsense and generally making one doubt the safe future of the world. Regardless of these twits, afternoon tea is delightful! Oh, and I had to pay for valet service? what is with that?

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: calAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while in Miami after a couple of nights at South Beach. The hotel was great. The reception area is beautiful and the staff extremely accomodating.The rooms are very large and we had a nice big balcony with views over the water. The room itself was nicely decorated and had an amazingly comfy bed with heaps of feather pillows. The pool area looked very nice although we didn't use the pool I felt the water and it was a perfect temperature! I would recommend the hotel to anyone, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY !!!”
Reviews.Author: Rover87
Reviews.Content: 1st off...Anyone says otherwise is really just nitpicking or being negative. I have travelled the world (over 30 countries) for business and pleasure and this hotel was up there with the best of them. Some of the reviews on this site actually made me think twice but I'm glad I listened to my gut. The HOTEL STAFF were EXTREMELY courteous. Every single employee had a smile and every person had a friendly greeting as you walked by. The rooms were spotless and the bathrooms were great. The hotel was sparkling clean and the pool was fabulous. Me and the wife were there for our anniversary and the staff REALLY did everything they could to make the stay memorable. Everything from rose petals in the room, to chocolate covered strawberry's to gift wrapping a jar of dill pickles and having them ready by the bed (by wife gets cravings at night !!lol). We saw a few NBA players strolling by also and I doubt they'd stay at somewhere that was less than fantastic. Great food and service once again. The only drawback was that it was a bit far from South Beach and the cab rides to the beach are a bit expensive if your going to and from over a number of days. Good LUck !

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: finance1
Reviews.Content: We (family including two kids- 9 and 12) had a great time at the Ritz in Coconut Grove. The staff treated us right, including nice touches like sending chocolate strawberries for our anniversary. We were a little unsure after reading some reviews here, but after calling the hotel, they assured us we would have a great time. Perhaps the call is why we were upgraded to a huge suite. August is off season in Miami, so we got a great rate (including breakfast and valet parking) and had a great getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but tacky charge for internet”
Reviews.Author: viaggiatora
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights in early June 2007. Since I am disabled, I asked for and received an accessible room. It was very well geared to my needs. The bathroom had a walk in shower with a handheld shower and a seat The bedroom was nicely furnished and spacious. There was a small balcony too with an ok view. It was super clean, quiet and in short, was a place we'd go back to. The only disappointment was their charging $10.00 per day for internet access. Plus, room service food was terrible and extremely overpriced... an undercooked, Domino's quality 8"pizza cost $14.95!! Just don't order room service unless you're desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: MaryC_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Despite what I have read in other reviews, I had an excellent experience at the Ritz-Carlton. I have stayed at numerous hotels for business and pleasure in the past, but none have been more impressive. The most impressive aspect of my business trip was the extraordinary service I received from the staff. I have stayed in South Beach on numerous occasions and have basically been ignored by hotel staff (not at a Ritz-Carlton) while paying a fortune for a room. However, at the Ritz-Carlton Coconut Grove every request I made was carried out quickly and efficiently. In addition, they did everything they could to anticipate my needs. This was my first experience at a Ritz-Carlton and, after this experience, I will definitely stay at the hotel when I return to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: maciasrogelio
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Miami area about 3 times a month and after hearing great things about The Ritz Carlton in Coconut Grove, I opted to book my reservation for 2 nights. Small yet well maintained, I was greeted by a delightful young lady named Mrs. Ashlee whom made me feel that the entire stay would be worth well the cost. Throughout the day I was on business and was not able to enjoy what the hotel has to offer but at night the lobby lounge had great music and a great server at the bar. Housekeeping did a great job with the room I was in and the phone operator never missed my wake up calls. I highly considered making this the hotel I would be staying in from now on but my experience was ruined at check out. The gentleman at the front desk, Mr. Alvaro was rather rude and expressionless through out the entire check out process. I congratulated him on such a fine hotel and he did not even make eye contact, he just asked me to repeat the room number I was checking out from, printed my bill and layed it flat on the counter. I only made one insignificant comment about housekeeping misplacing my newspaper and his response was, "you should have called housekeeping or bought a new one". However, my bellman (young man, Ian/Ean) was very kind and welcomed me back and helped me into my cab. I'll be trying yet another hotel in a week or so.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the Ritz?”
Reviews.Author: Arie-Mordejai
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at the Ritz Carlton in Coconut Grove. I was pretty excited, this was my first stay at a Rtiz. Well, really I would not spend the money to stay at a Rtiz again. The service was slow and unprofessional. it took them forever to answer the phone. At the breakfast buffet I had to go outside and fetch my own cofee refill. On top of everything, it took the valet an average of 30 minutes to bring your car out. And the last day after check out, the valet aerea was INSANE: They had lost a guest's car ( not mine ) it was sunday and people were arriving for Sunday brunch and they did not have enough people to attend to the arriving and departing cars. After 1 hour wait the brought my car out. Fortunately I was not going to the airport at that time, but had I been in a rush to catch a plane, I would have missed it. The saving grace was the people at the store. The attendand was pretty nice and eventhough I did not purchase anything she was gracious and friendly. If you want fancy soaps and spacious rooms, book the 4 seasons.

Reviews.Title: “This place used to be fantasic. What happened?”
Reviews.Author: bradowpc
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Grove frequently on business and I am pretty taken aback by how rapidly downhill this place seems to be headed. The rooms and hallways are starting to look very worn out. The service is very hit and miss. Check-in and check-out were fine and several employees made good efforts, but the lobby bartender and one of the valets provided some of the rudest service I've ever encountered. The clientele seems to be getting less polished and much more "gangsta" which doesn't help matters. The hotel is the last of the three Ritz properties in South Florida to have eliminated the tea service, and many of the little Ritz touches which are around before are now absent. The bottom line is that I could formerly expect consistent outstanding service and quality at this property, and this is clearly no longer the case. I still don't think there's a better place to stay in the Grove, however. But that's not saying much when one considers the alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “The Finest Details and Ultimate Elegance.”
Reviews.Author: Saipu
Reviews.Content: Online I stumbled upon a summer deal during July, which is actually low season for vacationing in Miami. I decided to go for the gusto and live it up a bit. Cost no object for several days. From the moment you step through the doors, Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove is the ultimate in upscale and service. This was my first time staying in a hotel in Coconut Grove and I enjoyed every minute of it. Very quiet! Why not go 5-star in the quiet community of the Grove, compared to South Beach. I was super impressed with the chocolates that were laid out every evening. They even turned the radio to relaxing jazz and latin jazz stations. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was super clean. This was my first 5-star hotel stay and I see why the Ritz-Carlton is at the top in its class. I felt out of place in a way, almost a spy to the very well-to-do class, whom I met in the lounge daily. This Ritz-Carlton has condo residences and usually the lounge is treated as their entertaining room. Everyone I met was very nice to me. No snobs, all down to earth. In a place like this, one can do "power" networking. The hotel is close to Cocowalk so you don't need a car, all within reach. The spa was fabulous as well. Ultimate treatment! The lobby lounge was wonderful. My first real Mojito was served to me in Bizcaya, their posh upscale restaurant. The breakfast there was fabulous! I spent every evening downstairs in the lobby lounge people watching, sipping on cocktails, mingling while listening to the live vocalist and piano player. The Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove is the ultimate in providing a stay away from and alternative to the hectic South Beach area. I highly recommend this hotel for those wanting elegance off the overly beaten South Beach path.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Ritz standards”
Reviews.Author: Homergirl
Reviews.Content: Miami was just a quick layover for us on our way back from Mexico to NY. Unfortunately, we flew on the day of a blizzard back home and the airports were shut down. We were told by American that we would have to spend 4 days before getting another flight out. As horrible as that sounded, we thought we would try to make the best of it and stay at a Ritz. We generally frequent Ritz Carltons, and know and love their service and standards. Let me say by no means is this Ritz up to standards. First off we checked in at a very late hour. We got a handicapped room (no biggie) and was told that we would be switched to a suite gratis in the morning when occupancy went down. Mind you we didn't ASK for one, they offered. The room was fine, was up to ritz standards, very clean and in order. Also very quiet. The balcony was filty and when you walked out on it in stocking feet, your feet would be black. When we woke in the morning, we went to the front to inquire about our room change and were greeted with "who said you could have a suite? we don't have a suite for you, who did you talk to, your just going to have to move out of that room and get another, but certainly not a suite" I was dumbfounded by her demeanor. Certainly not the "Ritz" "our pleasure" policy. So in any event, they insisted on switching us to another room but a regular room instead of a handicapped. This room was quite different than the previous room. Dirty carpets, dirty bathroom and walls, rusty fixtures in bath. Basically it looked as if the housekeeper in this room (422) did not do her job very well. Plus to make matters worse, our neighbor we could hear as if he were in the room with us. Very annoying. Every day the Ritz states that they have 2 services to the room, one regular service during the day, and then a turn down at night. Our housekeeper would do both at the same time, and mind you the turn down was nothing special. But turn down is a way for housekeeping to refresh towels and give you ice, put robes out etc....this was never done, and as a matter of fact as our stay went on, the housekeeper did les and less to the room. It got to be where we would have to ask for toilet paper, and our bathtub was never cleaned out. We heard that the Sunday brunch was the BEST in Miami, and for 100 bucks per person it should be. We decided to go directly to the restaurant and inquire. The gentleman (guessing manager?) told us that the last seating was at 3pm. So we booked for 3:00 as we wanted to shop a bit before going to brunch. We were starving by 2:30 and decided to try to sit then. We were horrified when we got there and they were breaking down the stations. I quickly asked the woman who was sitting us and her reply was "we close in 20 minutes". 20 minutes? I said. I was told the last SEATING was 3pm. She quickly changed her tune and assured us that we would have plenty to eat. We went to the sushi station, CLOSED they placed a bunch of sushi out and took off. Then went to the caviar station, while it was still open no one was there to serve me. We quickly got as much as we thought we would need and sat down, and while we were eating, the guy manning the dessert station came out and said "do you guys want any crepes for dessert?" dessert? we just sat down. Well he wanted to know so he could break down his station. A complete joke. Staff at this Ritz were unfriendly (except a few) and uncaring. I found this especially true with the front desk staff. One day I asked where I could exchange some money, and was given a stern "I have no idea".... this is highly unlike Ritz, where they generally would say " I am not sure, but let me find out for you".... The clincher was upon checking out I said "hello, we are checking out of room 422 please" and the gentleman behind the desk did not say ONE WORD to me, not hello, not how was your stay, not ONE WORD....just handed me my bill and walked away. NICE. I really don't know what has happened to the Ritz lately, perhaps it was the buyout from Marriott? But they certainly need to get their act together, it is generally our address and preference to travel to Ritz Carltons, but we are seriously considering others now.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say its the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: ellie0916
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our wedding night before taking off to Europe for our honeymoon. This is one of the best hotel experiences that we have had. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the room itself was clean and spacious with a very comfortable bed. The only thing that we didn't like was the fact that we had to pay for internet at this hotel where as you could get internet for free in other cheaper hotels. All in all though, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and I would stay there myself again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- great service - but know the location”
Reviews.Author: RdSxfn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with two friends and had a very good stay indeed. Initially I was somewhat concerned as there were some negative reviews on this site (and not just "the drinks at the pool are expensive" type complaints, which I ignore ). My fears proved unfounded. I can say that the staff there - at evey level- went out of their way to make our stay and could not have been more accomodating. The concierge/guest services personnel were exceptional. We booked a suite which worked well for the three of us as it had one and a half baths. One of us had to sleep on the sofa bed, which she swore was comfortable but I am not so sure - she told me that there was a significant extra charge for a rollaway bed, which is why we didn't get one (and which seems like a unfair extra charge - even regular Marriotts don't charge, and this is their luxury brand) . The room was spacious, the bed super comfy. Service was, as I said, very solicitous. The spa is pretty small, but adequate and the services were good, but nothing special. The pool is nice, but no view, and the pool staff were very attentive. One thing I should point out is that this hotel is about ten or fifteen minutes drive to Miami beach and South Beach, so don't stay here if you want a beach front location, or even one that is in very close proximity. It is in about a five or ten minute walk to all the shopping streets of Coconut Grove, lots of little shoppies and restaurants, nothing very special really. It is nice and quiet at the hotel, so if you want a very comfortable and somewhat plush environment away from the hustle and bustle of the beachfront, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Manager11
Reviews.Content: Visited Ritz Coconut Grove 15-19 Dec 06. Booked a suite thru expedia. Got a great price, and a lovely room with two balconies. This hotel was perfect in every way! The restaurant was great, service was great, beds fantastic. Could not say enough about this hotel. Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prance
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when I saw some poor reviews on here for the Ritz in Coconut Grove. I had a wonderful experience there, the staff was wonderful, when I checked in they wanted to take my bag to the room so I could get directly to the reception I was attending (late flights, got there late). The room was immaculate, the staff could not have been more accomodating. They could not accomodate my request for a king bed at the last moment (I had asked for two doubles originally, but family couldn't come with me at the last minute). They apologized and gave me a room with a beautiful view instead. My only compaint would be that the restaurant was VERY overpriced and not that good. Otherwise I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great, Not quite the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: heel5man
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Cocunut Grove for a group meeting in October, where by the way it's still quite warm in Miami! Overall, the hotel has a very nice feel to it with luxurious amenities in the lobby and a clean and bright atmosphere. The rooms were pretty nice and I had a decent view of the Biscayne Bay if I looked to the right off the nice balcony. My room was clean and furnished nicely. The only complaints I had were: 1) Room service menu was limited in its offering, and the NY steak I ordered was really sub-par. 2) I had to call two days in a row to have the mini bar restocked. The first request, which came mid-afternoon, went ignored that day. I called back the next day and made the same request to the same person who this time had it taken care of and apologized it wasn't handled the previous day. You'd think they would be making the effort to keep these things stocked with the profit margin they have on the items stocked. 3) The final day we were there, they were "testing" the fire alarm system. We were given plenty of notice of this, but the problem was it literally went on for hours. Hours of flashing lights, warning voices, and noise. It seems like they could have taken care of this in much less time than several hours. It really was quite a distraction to our meeting. The only complaints I heard from my fellow group members were about the showers, which apparently leaked water all over the floor. In my shower, the caulking was completely stripped off one side, but these things happen and I'm sure someone caught it soon thereafter. My door lock was broken which I didn't mention to anyone, but on the second day I was there, a maintainence person knocked on the door and took care of it. I love to see proactive action like that, so they obviously have someone on the ball. Overall, not a bad stay other than the fire alarm -- and our group rate of $199 I think was very fair considering it was the off season.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel facility in decline”
Reviews.Author: Selectiveguest
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this location before and have been pleased with the quality of the rooms and service. It was evident on this visit that the facility has declined significantly and certainly is not Ritz quality. The room had a strong musty scent, which we discovered was from Mildew which was visible in the air conditioning vents. The furniture was stained and dirty. We were moved to another room upon request but had the hotel been booked, it would have been a miserable stay. Another thing to watch if you book a package, which includes breakfast, parking and a spa credit - these items are likely to show up on your bill anyway - so pls read your bill. This happened the last time we were there a year ago and happened to us this stay (and to the couple checking out in front of us). Management must do something dramatic to increase the quality of this hotel! I feel sorry for those who invested in this property. Your investment is not being well protected.

Reviews.Title: “Stop!!! Please read urgent update”
Reviews.Author: goodygude
Reviews.Content: ****PLEASE STOP AND READ THIS UPDATE***** I must say I was quite dismayed when reading the reviews of this hotel...so much so, that I contacted the hotel directly and spoke with the Director of Operations, Andrew Roberts and told him of this site and the terrible ratings and reviews this particular property had received. I also advised him, I am a repeat customer for the Ritz-Carlton brand and this holiday especially was important as my husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary. I was candid with Mr. Roberts and advised him, due to these reviews I am considering cancelling my reservation. He was not aware of this site or the reviews. Ritz-Carlton uses other types of media to determine customer satisfaction. Needless to say, I kept the reservation and we arrived there this past Monday, Sept. 11, 2006. I had previously requested an early checkin, we were just getting off a cruise ship and we have an infant son. They complied with no incident. They were expecting us and upgraded us to a suite. There was a small delay in waiting for the room, but it was fine. Once we got in the room, it was absolutely gorgeous!!! In the room waiting for us was a chilled bottle of champagne and tuxuedo strawberries, very nice touch!! The room had two balconies and two bathrooms, very roomy (great when you have a crawling baby!1) and just wonderful. The staff greeted us by name and we were thoroughly pleased. We did the usual tourist excursions, and when we returned our bed had beautiful baby pink rose petals on it, shaped in the shape of a heart. Beautiful presentation throughout, which is what we usually expect from Ritz Carlton. My husband and I are loyal customers. So, for all those out there, like myself, that really read these reviews to make decisions on where to stay, kindly let me suggest The Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove, it really is a great property, with great staff, and I believe that they will truly try to improve, given this new information.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Ritz Carlton - This place is a 1 star”
Reviews.Author: baddabingtim
Reviews.Content: I work in Coral Gables and Live in Boston, so I know the hotels in the area - my wife came down and I booked the Ritz - figured it was 5 star - what a mistake - room I got was a handicap room with paper thin walls - service stunk - pool is crack - location is not as convenient as the sonesta - We complained and tried to switch rooms and they did not budge - I am writing this review from the Le Meridian in Sunny Isles - which is great - My advice is if you go to the Grove - Skip this dive
